comments.commentBody: Smart neighbor avoid conflict with neighbors.  Russia and europe both christian nations should avoid conflicts.

I think Trump is clueless about any of this and that the American intelligence officials are at fault here. I'm not sure if Obama had any clues either. Basically our whole government is broken at every level and needs to be fixed so this relationship with Russia is interesting. Some Republicans just hate the government but they seem to be okay with Russia and their almost-dictatorship/communism and total government control. Or maybe we're all really ignorant. Maybe this is the beginning of friendly relations with Russia and China? Many Americans hate China for stealing our jobs but maybe not Russia since they seem mostly white and they don't remember the Cold War at all. Maybe Sessions thought talking with Russian leaders were harmless and didn't think they'll hack anything. I feel bad for the guy for blindingly trusting other countries' leaders and not thinking of them as spies. But if we really want a peaceful world, we should drop our guard and start believing in the good of others. I think that's the true liberalism spirit.
I thought the cold was was over. Didn't President Obama tell us that? Did not matter until the Democrat lost an election.

Oh really my fellow Americans, are you so insular and fixated on the present that you honestly believe that foreign interests have been disinterested in regime changes in other countries till now? Alliances have been made and broken since time immemorial in order to strengthen or weaken one side or another. This hypocritical stance by the lib-dem block and supporting press is an ill-fated, desperate attempt to reverse the results of an election by whipping up a frenzy about "foreign" interference in our election. How pathetic, how ridiculous, how trivial! I sincerely hope that a cooperative modus vivendi is worked out between Russia and the USA and, frankly, Yalta was not such a bad deal considering. Grow up and move on, for heavens sake.

Sometime during the recent presidential campaign, my wife and I were watching some TV channel covering the day's events.  We both remember seeing Rudy Giuliani, then an avid surrogate for Donald Trump, now relegated to obscurity.   The topic of discussion back then was Russian intervention in the US election.  At one point during the discussion, Giuliani smiled knowingly like the cat who ate the canary.  Any investigation of Russian hijinks MUST determine what Giuliani knew and when he knew it.

"During that campaign"? When is America not having a campaign?

Franken et al should keep the questions sumple: "When did you stop taliking to Russians?" and "Do you agree that Putin's a killer?"

Reading this article, it becomes clear that the Obama administration decided to spread unsubstantiated suppositions around and made sure that they would be known to many partisans in the bureaucracy. Further, they made the verification of these innuendos impossible by classifying the actual contact info. Frankly, I am amazed to find that our bumbling former president could be so clever. His personal dislike of the man who accused him of being born in Kenya has always been evident to all, but I didn't expect such a clever sabotage of the incoming administration.

I guess that President Obama really did learn those lessons of Saul Alinsky, as Fox News always claims!

As a subscriber to this ever-diminishing "news" paper, please get back to me when at least one of these anonymous leakers comes forward with actual facts.

replies.commentBody: Given Nixon's later diffuculties in the same arena, I'm inclined to think LBJ was engage it some Texan hyperbole.  After all, at the time be was trying to 'buy them off' and was discouraged that they wouldn't 'make a deal'. .

comments.commentBody:
Richard Nixon committed treason when he sent envoys to meet secretly with the North Vietnamese in 1968 to undermine Lyndon Johnson's peace talks. LBJ pointed that out in a phone call (recorded) but said if he brought it up he would be accused -- by the GOP -- of playing politics with national security.

Ronald Reagan's campaign -- likely in the person of GHW Bush -- committed treason in 1980 when "someone" secretly met with representatives of Iran to ask them to continue holding American hostages until after election day, so that Reagan could use "the hostage crisis" against President Carter. Shortly after he "won" the election, Reagan's staff made arrangements for the hostages to be released at 12:01 p.m. on Inauguration Day, and soon thereafter sold arms to Iran through Nicaraguan rebels. Carter and his people refused to call it treason, lest they be accused -- by the GOP -- of "playing politics" with the hostage crisis.

WHEN will the American people wake up to the fact that the Republican Party is filled with traitors to the United States, and that their repeated treason over the past 50 years makes them a clear and present danger to our nation? When will American traitors be charged, tried, and executed?
Espionage is a wicked business, folks.
So Democrats.....show us the evidence..........very simple.

In my opinion it is getting quite old, as well as blaring obvious, that the Democrats as well as their surrogate press, are out to make anybody in the Trump administration look bad. Classic witch hunt. Time to get on with important accomplishments for our nation. Not much ado about nothingness.

replies.commentBody: German TV had a docu. on trolls and cyber manipulation last week. It said that 45% of anti-Merkel social media posts originated in the US-  ID unknown, but those also supported Brexit and Trump. Someone is playing with us, and it's not just the Russians.

comments.commentBody:
This is the new warfare.

When the election tampering was first detected, a public service announcement in the form of a warning regarding all "news" information should have been made.

Such a public awareness campaign could have:
1. Provided tips on how to detect fraudulent news in PSA's and on government web sites, plus through major news channels
2. Set up a process for certifying sources of news
3. Set up a process for flagging "fake news" in conjunction with major aggregators
4. Applied a "verified news source" certification and imprint for trusted news websites in conjunction with fact-checking organizations
5. Allowed for independent news and blogging, but with a disclaimer differentiating them from sites whose news is independently fact-checked
6. Applied a 3-strikes-in-1-month policy towards outlets that earned certification, and then distributed substantially "fake" articles to suspend certification
7. Applied a 2-outs policy towards such outlets to permanently revoke certification

And I'm just an AMATEUR.

THANK YOU, FORMER PRESIDENT OBAMA!

Thank you for being smart enough, stealthy enough, intuitive enough and trusted enough to protect our nation, its people, and our Consitution by working with other government department heads to SAVE much of these files and information from the Trump Administration's "Delete" button cover-up!!

Thank you for foreseeing this Trump situation as the nightmare it is... and doing your duty to keep us - the American People - safe and informed.

Sooner or later it will be common knowledge that you, sir, were truly heroic in these actions!

This is the clearest explanation to date of efforts by Obama, his political appointees, and partisan career employees throughout government to undermine and sabotage Trump and his Administration.
They went so far as to involve as many people as possible and to make as many people aware as they could that they considered Trump dangerous to the Republic, even involving a willing media in their plot so that the general public became aware. They encouraged their supporters to #Resist, demonstrate, attend townhalls, and prepare for 2018.
Breadcrumbs were reportedly left. The leakers claimed that the most highly classified materials were consolidated in the hands of only a few trustworthy people so that investigators could solve the coming problems of treason and treachery. Trump could be stopped.

So now we know that there is indeed a plot by the former Obama Administration to overthrow our current government.
Thanks, NYT.

What just happened?
I opened this mornings (Friday) digital Times and half of the page was in Russian. The print scrolled to the right of my screen. I don't see an accompanying story.
Surely, I am mistaken. Paranoid? Delusional?

This was a brilliant move by the Obama administration. Thank you.
I am an Independent voter, but say what you will, Mr. Obama has integrity.
It's frightening that history, the news and the rhetoric from Mr. Trump are not trustworthy. He will not disclose his tax returns. He will not divest from his corporation. Nepotism is rampant. Racism is blatant. How did this happen?
I suggest that we dismantle the electoral college. It is no longer relevant.

If President Obama's legacy wasn't secure before, it certainly is now.

To the seditious Republicans, who were so smugly certain they would obliterate him; to the gang of thugs and swamp rats now "advising" the Current Occupant who have engaged with a hostile power to install a morally and mentally unfit, two-bit grifter in the Oval Office; and to SCROTUS, whose days are filled with obsessive TV watching, simmering rage over slights real and imagined, and cold revenge; the golden words of Nelson Muntz: HA ha!
At what point does it become Sedition?

Lots of speculation yet NO substantive facts have been leaked - isn't that odd?

Perhaps the American People need to insist that full-time Senators and Congressmen should NOT be allowed to actively participate in election campaigns not their own unless they take a non-paid leave of absence from Congress! Taxpayers should not be paying for political activities of their representatives.

This is NOT about:

* Who won or lost the election.

* Why ANYONE won or lost the election.

It *IS* about Russian cyber warfare attacks on United States

To anyone who thinks that there's no direct Russian connection to Trump in this whole mess, let's not forget--TRUMP is the one who made a public plea to the Russians to hack American servers to find Clinton's emails. And then he made the same statement AGAIN on twitter. This isn't a he said, she said thing. You can watch the video and read the hundreds of articles that were written about the incident. So let's be clear: Trump isn't an innocent bystander in this mess. Rather, he's the one who invited the Russians--on national television and on a high-profile social media platform--to interfere with our political process. Trump's cast of sycophants described the comment as a "joke." Is anyone laughing? I'm not laughing. Yelling "bomb!" in an airport will get you arrested, regardless of whether it was intended as a joke. In other words, it's not about intent, it's about consequences. And Trump needs to be held accountable for a grave breach of national security.

What this article makes clear, to me, is the United States has been attacked, surreptitiously, via the very systems we created and promulgated to the world. The Internet and the vast globally webbed together world. The irony is supreme. American's need to realize something in all this. The Cold War never went away from Russia's perspective. America thought it was done, but it isn't. Our thinking that the Cold War was a historical relic has made us fat, complacent and lazy in geo-politics.

Trump and his ilk's treasonous acts are the vectors used in conducting the attack. America needs to wake up and realize we're in a new Cold War folks, and it has heated up out there in Cyberspace. If we don't recognize its nature and stop acting like the complacent Empire we have become then we will be paying for it into the far future. And we will deserve all that we get. The first step in correcting the situation? Bringing Trump and his minions to heel. Quickly.

John~
American Net'Zen

I wonder how far this story can go without actual evidence and what damage it will ultimately do to the democratic party and the media credibility when it is likely shown as a tempest in a tea kettle...
We need to put together a large reward for anyone leaking information about the Russian connection, the tax returns and the conflicts of interest.

replies.commentBody:
Agent P, they were monitoring...Russians. The Trump Republican campaign operatives just weren't making a big secret of theirRussian conntacts. The big red flag is that they chose to lie about these contacts when confronted with them, sometimes under oath.

If everything was aboveboard, why bother to lie? You don't speak for "the rest of America" nor do you have a crystal ball.

comments.commentBody:
More troubling to me, but obviously not to progressives, is a Democratic administration using the intelligence and surveillance power of the CIA, NSA, etc to monitor the Republicans, the opposition party. Watergate pales in comparison to these activities and Obama administration instigators of them should be investigated.

As to this whole Russia influencing and conspiring with the Trump campaign, this will prove to be a lot of smoke with little to no fire. Just the kind of fake news the liberal MSM thrives on. The rest of America has already moved on.
